title: Custodial Death:Three Cops Tortured And Murdered Man In Front Of His 10-Year-Old Son In UP. They're Suspended But No FIR Yet
text:
Three Cops Tortured And Murdered Man In Front Of His 10-Year-Old Son In UP. They're Suspended But No FIR Yet

Three Cops Tortured And Murdered Man In Front Of His 10-Year-Old Son In UP. They're Suspended But No FIR Yet

Three policemen, including the SHO of Pilkhua, in Hapur, were suspended for allegedly torturing a man in custody, which eventually resulted in his death.

Pradeep Tomar, a resident of Pilkhua had left his home along with his 10-year-old son after he was summoned by the cops in connection with a murder case.

BCCL/ REPRESENTATIONAL IMAGE

According to his son, Tomar was tortured for hours by the cops who kicked, punched, hit with planks of wood, given electric shocks and pierced with a screwdriver him.

Tomar was rushed to a Meerut hospital after his condition worsened and he died during treatment.

A video purportedly shot by some locals is making rounds on social media. It showed severe torture marks all over his body.

A man named Pradeep Kumar, resident of UP's Hapur district was illegally detained by the local police and given third degree torture for hours leading to his death. Four cops including an inspector and a sub-inspector have been suspended. @Uppolice pic.twitter.com/qFHfpfiZDC — Piyush Rai (@Benarasiyaa) October 14, 2019

Following the incident, three policemen, including SHO of Pilkhua police station, have been suspended.

The Times of India reported that now the Tomar family is under pressure to settle the issue and not file an FIR against the police officers.

Day 2 and still NO FIR has been registered in horrific Hapur custodial torture case. Senior police officials claim that they are yet to get official complaint while family is claiming otherwise. Here I speak to Kuldeep Tomar, younger brother of deceased Pradeep Tomar.

Listen in pic.twitter.com/wOhSC8kXS0 — Piyush Rai (@Benarasiyaa) October 15, 2019

The report also added that Hapur SP Yeshveer Singh claimed that they are yet to receive any complaint from the family.

“Three policemen have been suspended. Further action will be taken only after findings of post-mortem report and other relevant facts which will come up during primary probe are with us,” Meerut ADG Prashant Kumar told The Times of India.
